Class TotalisticRule

java.lang.Object
Rule
TotalisticRule
public class TotalisticRule extends Rule
TotalisticRule represents any one of the 64 rules that govern the evolution of 1D, two-state totalistic CAs with a neighborhood radius of 2.
Author:
Mounir Zahidi

  • Method Details

    • getNeighborhood

      public boolean[] getNeighborhood​(int index, Generation gen)
      Specified by:
      getNeighborhood in class Rule
      Parameters:
      index - index of the cell in the generation
      gen - the generation containing the cell states
      Returns:
      the state of the cell with the given index in the given Generation along with the states of its two nearest neighbors from each side.

    • evolve

      public boolean evolve​(boolean[] neighborhood)
      Return the next state of a cell with the given neighborhood of states. The input is an array that contains the states of two left neighbors, the cell itself, and two right neighbors (in that order).
      Specified by:
      evolve in class Rule
      Parameters:
      neighborhood - the boolean array[] representing the neighborhood of the cell in question.
      Returns:
      the state of the cell according to the wolfram code rule

    • ruleTableString

      public String ruleTableString​(char falseSymbol, char trueSymbol)
      Specified by:
      ruleTableString in class Rule
      Parameters:
      falseSymbol - the char Symbol representing the true value.
      trueSymbol - the char symbol representing the false value.
      Returns:
      A string representation of the table depicts the rule using the given characters to represent false and true.

      Overrides:
